channel.title: Redirection on Where DFIR Meets IT
channel.description: Recent content in Redirection on Where DFIR Meets IT

item.title: Road to RHCSA 8 - I/O Redirection, Piping, and Their Evil Uses
item.description: Bourne-compatible Unix shells (bash, sh, etc.) usually include capabilities to redirect input and output in the shell. One of the basic objectives of RHCSA 8 is to learn how to manipulate input and output, and since I work in security I wanted to put a spin on the content to show how adversaries may use I/O redirection to stump defenders. If you already know about I/O redirection and you’re just here for the security stuff, jump forward here.
